User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
With summer fast approaching, many #association #budget cycles will soon begin. Are you (and your #event) prepared for a potential #recession?

When budgeting in a time of financial uncertainty be sure you consider the following:

1) Do you have a plan if your #meeting or #tradeshow occurs during a recession that’s seeing a 30%-50% drop in sales? (i.e.: What's the potential revenue impact? This is especially important for B2C and B2B tradeshows, but also those #meetings with exhibitors and sponsors who may also need to make different financial decisions during a recession).

2) What if, at the same time, your meeting or tradeshow costs are rising 10%-30% with inflation?

3) What are ways your meeting or event can continue to grow during a recession? (and what are the implications and ramifications if it can't grow?)

Don't be caught off guard! Paying close attention to economic conditions and trends and making prudent decisions early can help you slow down some of the potential negative financial impacts during a recession.

#meetingprofs #eventprofs #meetingsmeanbusiness #meetingsandevents

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Airfare prices are SOARING past inflation (~1 minute read)

"The price of plane tickets increased by 18.6% during April — the biggest one-month spike in the history of the Consumer Price Index ... and domestic airfare prices are up 40% since January."

High fuel prices, staffing shortages and pent up demand are all driving ticket prices higher. If you're a #meetingprof or #eventprof planning a domestic event, these increases may impact your already hurting attendee base and your consistent attendees may reconsider shelling out the dollars to attend your #meeting or #event.

If you're planning international events, travel outside of the US is still down 20 - 40%, so your attendees may not feel the sticker shock, but they may still have re-entry COVID-19 hurdles to deal with.

#meetingprofs #eventprofs #meetingsmeanbusiness #travel #airlines

Post Description:
This morning my friends over at The Hustle posted a brief article on the fate of virtual events, spotlighting some of the recent challenges faced by #eventtech purveyor Hopin.

The article closed with the following observation: "Despite the drop in demand, virtual events will likely have a role going forward, especially virtual work events and conferences, which are cheaper, more inclusive, and more environmentally friendly than in-person meetings."

While I don't necessarily agree with their conclusion, I'm interested in hearing from my #meetingprof and #eventprof colleagues. Are virtual events cheaper? Are they more #inclusive? Are they more environmentally friendly?

Are you #teaminperson, #teamdigital or #teamhybrid when it comes to #meetings and #events? Sound off below in the comments!

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Are you a #CEM in the D.C., Maryland or Virginia area looking for the next step in your professional learning journey?

If so, you should consider the International Association of Exhibitions and Events (IAEE) Certified in Exhibition Management Advanced Professional certification program (CEM-AP)!

The CEM-AP program is for CEMs with at least 10 years of industry experience who have acquired 30 education/leadership credits (through a combination of leadership activities and industry-related continuing education) who must also complete one mandatory two-day course. 

The course, Leading and Negotiating for Success, will be offered during Business Events Industry Week at the Gaylord National Harbor Resort & Convention Center in National Harbor, MD on 22-23 March 2022.

You can learn more about the program and find the application at: https://lnkd.in/ed8WMEbm

#eventprofs #meetingprofs #meetingsmeanbusiness #meetingsandevents #tradeshows #leadership #education

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
"Remote workers are using the bathroom during meetings"

We often rush with excitement to engage in new trends and fads, especially with technology, however, this NPR piece hits on the cost to and loss of productivity associated with long-term virtual work.

Zoom and web-based interactions are here to stay, but to imply that they will replace a traditional in person working environment (when safely accessible and available) is simply not true.

Remote or nomadic work can be fun for a while, but generally is not a long-term sustainable model for most people and the organizations which they support. Don't rush to pack up your cubicle or office, because at some point, you'll likely be returning.

#remotework #virtualwork #technology #productivity #futureofwork

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
"This is a matter of timing".

Although brief, this piece from Meetings & Conventions magazine is spot on when it comes to navigating force majeure and cancellation. The old adage of "timing is everything" can mean the difference between FM and a breach of contract suit.

As a #meetingprof be sure to know the terms, conditions and clauses in your contract(s) and when it's best to start discussing force majeure and cancellation with your supplier partners.

#eventprofs #meetingsandevents #meetingsmeanbusiness

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
"The meetings industry will need to work together to create consistent standards, [and to] separate itself from other kinds of mass gatherings ...". “We are very fragmented as an industry as far as guidelines". 

While I appreciate the honesty and transparency of these statements from destination professionals, what this piece omitted, was a specific call out to meetings professionals to also come together, in a more formal manner, to develop guidelines for our profession. 100% of the onus can't be on our hospitality partners and right now, they're doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. 

As #meetingprofs we have a responsibility to our profession and ALL of our stakeholders to be meaningfully involved and engaged in the process --- which is something we're not currently doing in force.

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Apple's new ad "nails the work from home experience. Unfortunately, that's not necessarily a good thing." Acknowledging the ad's humor but also many of its underlying disturbing realities, Inc. Magazine's Jason Aten issues a call to action to all leaders.

"If your team is overwhelmed and under-resourced, that's on you as a leader. If your team is struggling to balance their life with their work right now, that's on you as a leader. And if you're dropping unrealistic expectations on them, that's right, it's on you."

I get it --- we're all, leaders and team members alike, simultaneously learning to navigate these new working conditions, AND you as a leader, have the responsibility to your team to provide the best possible working conditions and experience.

What are you doing to lead your team right now? How are you exercising understanding, patience and compassion? What could you be doing better? Who can you partner with to improve the experience across the board for your organization?

#meetingprofs #eventprofs #workfromhome #leadership #leader #management #prodevo #professionaldevelopment #maskup #wearpants #washyourhands

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
If you have not read the most recent "Pulse Survey" from Northstar Meetings Group you need to add it to your reading list now.

1) "Fewer [#meetingprofs] are actively booking business; in fact, cancelling or rescheduling has become the primary job function of 60 percent of respondents." --- Read that again: "cancelling or rescheduling has become the primary job function of 60 percent of respondents."

2) "... four weeks ago, 40 percent of meeting planners expected to hold rescheduled events during this calendar year ... that number has declined to 25 percent, per the latest results." --- and confidence for Q1 & Q2 of 2021 isn't looking great either.

3) "The back-and-forth dance of open, close, open, close makes it impossible to plan for in-person events," lamented one respondent. "Opinions and perceptions change daily." --- Uncertainty prevails making it difficult to make decisions regarding face-to-face events.

Data points like the Northstar Pulse Survey are an excellent way to stay informed and up-to-date on the true state of the industry and should be added to your weekly/monthly reading list.

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description: Thank you to John Shertzer for reminding us all where we should be focusing during these unsettling times.

Repost.Original Post Description:
As an association leader, I’ve been struggling with the constant feeling like our organization should be doing more right now...that we need to do what our peers are doing...that we need to keep adding programs and services and initiatives (and webinars) by the dozens. 

But what’s the point in putting so much passion and energy into mission statements, purpose statements, plans, and all the rest, if NOT for moments like this?

A mission statement is not only there to be aspirational in times of abundance, but also an anchor in times of uncertainty. Staying disciplined to purpose is always tough, but especially now. And I think it’s still the right approach. 

The challenge of leadership right now is to meet the moment while staying true to our mission. Not easy, but grounded in purpose. #association #leadership #COVID19 #organizationaldevelopment

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Focusing your teams on the reasons it's okay to just do the essentials and just be right now is the most important role you can play as a leader during this crisis.

“It’s tough enough to be productive in the best of times let alone when we’re in a global crisis,” said Chris Bailey, a productivity consultant and the author of “Hyperfocus: How to Manage Your Attention in a World of Distraction.” “The idea that we have so much time available during the day now is fantastic, but these days it’s the opposite of a luxury. We’re home because we have to be home, and we have much less attention because we’re living through so much.”

#workfromhome #distracted #overwhelmed #pressure #intensity #meetingprofs #eventprofs #hospitality

Airlines are cancelling flights in countries and regions with outbreaks (ex: China, S. Korea). Large events like the Mobile World Congress cancelled their event scheduled to begin earlier this week. Make sure you know what's in your contract clause(s) and how unforeseen circumstances may impact your event and your expense line.

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
In 2019 the Financial Planning Association (FPA) started an initiative to #recycle conference vinyl and turn it into unique, durable bags and accessories like those in the picture below. This year FPA re-purposed 20 pounds of vinyl that was otherwise destined for landfills.

Thanks to our amazing partners at Mile High Workshop, the creation of these bags also provided meaningful work opportunities for those rebuilding from #addictions, #homelessness and #incarceration. 

While this is just one of many #green initiatives we undertake during and after our events, we look forward to expanding this program while simultaneously diverting waste from our landfills and giving back to our communities. 

If you’d like to know more about this project or our relationship with Mile High Workshop, give me a shout!

#sustainability #meaningfulwork #csr #meetingprof

May 9th, 2019
5:30 – 7:30 PM
DAGAR  | 2000 Lawrence St, Denver, CO 80202

Space is limited, so please register today!

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Are you a student or rising professional with 6 years or less of experience in the hospitality industry? 

If so, join members of the Rocky Mountain PCMA Emerging Leaders Committee to enjoy lunch and a guided discussion prior to MIC’s Planner Only session and the MIC Opening General Session at the Colorado Convention Center. 

Network with other industry professionals and ask questions to make the most of your MIC experience.  Following lunch, we will walk as a group over to MIC! #networking #meetingprofs #lunch

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description: This is an interesting piece on the other side of the Marriott commission cut. There are truths in the piece --- i.e. ALL planners (read --- not just intermediaries) need to be more responsible for the quality of their RFPs and that the landscape is changing regarding costs in the group sector. There is also some unfair deflection ---i.e hotels continue to benefit (i.e. profit) from a simpler RFP submission even if they've had to add additional staff, etc. (i.e. cost of business) & CVENT is NOT solely to blame for incomplete RFPs.

User: Kyle Jordan, CAE, CEM-AP, CMP, DES, CMM
Post Description:
Five months ago I started on a professional journey towards achieving my Certified Association Executive (CAE) credential. In place of my usual time spent  with family, friends and engaging in my favorite hobbies, I spent hours upon hours in various Starbucks locations reading books, articles and studying flashcards.  I even carried around  a giant 20+ pound backpack of my study materials all around the country during my travels.

Today I can happily report that all of the time, effort and hard work has paid off! Thank you to my family, friends and colleagues who supported me along this amazing ride. #asaeCAE

Post Description:
Using my best professional resources --- Each of YOU reading this post!

We're working hard to improve how we manage our scholarship and internship application processes for our student programs. We need a technology solution that can accept submissions, solicit recommendations, provide automatic reminders, allow remote reviewer scoring, etc.

Question is: What are your best technology solutions beyond Wufoo & SurveyMonkey for this type of scholarship/internship submission, review, and selection?
